net.rptools.maptool.model.MacroButtonPro.label: dnd5e_RollExpression_addTypedDescriptor
net.rptools.maptool.model.MacroButtonPro.toolTip:
This will add a descriptor to a roll expression. A descriptor has a key and a text value that
can be used in the output. All of the descriptors stored on the roll expression as an object

arg(0) = roll expression
arg(1) = descriptor type; The valid types are:
condition
Text was added by checking for a condition when rolling an attack
tooltipRoll
The roll expression used in a tooltip
tooltipDetail
The individual die rolls and bonus for the tool tip roll.
advantageable
Details on advantage/disadvantage and the cancelling of both
lucky
A die was rerolled for a lucky halfling
critable
There was a critical roll
saveable
There is damge or condition that can be saved
<
actionName
The name of the action in buttons and macros. Only attached to first expression.
actionDesc
Detail information that is added to the header as a tool tip, Only attached to first expression.
actionType
Indicates that the roll expression is for a specific type of action
rowId
The identifier used to match a roll expression with its associated form fields
extendedValues
Should extended values be shown for the step? The values are '+' if no extended values are shown, '-' means they are being shown. The value "" means the extended values are not set.
save-effect-damage
The damage done on a Save Damage expression after the save effect has been applied
action-execution-key
Key placed in the first object of a roll expression to attack a link from chat to a rolled expression
arg(2) = descriptor text
